result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiffany K Debord was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: --to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent

--no contact with Robert Meunier

--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription

--no possession or use of any drug paraphernalia 

--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by treating physician

--no contact with any know drug offender except for treatment and as deemed appropriate per Agent

--if permitted to travel out of State, no possession or use of marijuana(THC) in states where it is legal. No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express written permission of agent

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent

--random drug and/or alcohol screening

--to comply with DNA sample provision

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tiffany K Debord

records.addlTxt: Shunette Campbell Hunter
Public Defender Notification Sheet
w/ elements and ccs

[ma] Cases 21CF170, 22CF18, 22CF46 called at 2:19 PM 
Defendant Tiffany K Debord in court.  Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell in court for Tiffany K Debord.  Attorney Theresa Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1 of Case 21CF170, Counts #4 and #6 of Case 22CF46, Count #3 of Case 22CF18; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: Remaining Counts.

Sentencing recommendations/ arguments given by Counsel 

On Count #1 of Case 21CF170, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, concurrent, with conditions:
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--no contact with Victim 1
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--payment of costs, fees and surcharges
--payment of restitution to Victim 1, as listed on CCS, in an amount to be determined 

Days credit for time already served:  7  days

*********
On Counts #4 and #6 of Case 22CF46 and Count #3 of Case 22CF18, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 30 months, concurrent, with conditions:
--no contact with Robert Meunier
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession or use of any drug paraphernalia 
--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by treating physician
--no contact with any know drug offender except for treatment and as deemed appropriate per Agent
--if permitted to travel out of State, no possession or use of marijuana(THC) in states where it is legal. No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express written permission of agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--payment of costs, fees and surcharges

Days credit for time already served:  2  days as to Case 22CF46 and 8 days as to Case 22CF18.

The Court directs Ms. Debord to report to the Court/COC office that she went to SPD office by 4:00pm today 
recess: 2:50pm 
NEXT: Restitution Hearing on 10/27/22 at 3:00pm
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[ml] Cases 21CF170, 22CF18, and 22CF46 called at 9:12AM
Defendant Tiffany K Debord appears in court with attorney Shunette Torna Campbell Hunter. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Parson verifies Victim Rights Compliance.

As to files 22CF18 and 22CF46:
These files were scheduled for Preliminary Hearing, however the Defense files a waiver prior to the case being called.

Ms. Debord waives her right to Preliminary Hearings; the Court accepts these waivers and binds her over for Trials.

Arraignment:
--service of Informations admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited for both files
--pleas of "not guilty" entered as to all Counts in both files
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

Att Campbell Hunter advises that a global resolution offer exists, and requests that these matters be set for another Status Conference.

As to the attorney repayment fees:
The Court orders the Defendant to begin repayment of attorney fees on 10/05/2022, and on the 5th of every month thereafter, at a rate of $50.00 a month.

recess 9:23AM

Status conference on January 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

On 01/10/22, the Court ordered a bond in case 22CF18 during Intake. However, the Clerk mistakenly put the bond in file 21CF170. This error was corrected and the correct bond was put in file 22CF18 and removed from 21CF170.

Conditions of this bond include:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--no contact with Co-Defendants listed in the Criminal Complaint
